Hydropower.Description: Hydropower utilizes the force of flowing or falling water to generate electricity.
Hydropower requires the construction of dams to create reservoirs for water storage.
Hydropower uses turbines to convert the kinetic energy of water into mechanical energy.
Hydropower produces electricity as its primary output.
Hydropower falls under the category of renewable energy sources.
Hydropower involves the creation of reservoirs to store water for power generation.
Hydropower projects can have significant environmental impacts on ecosystems and wildlife.
Hydropower requires the construction of hydroelectric power plants for electricity generation.
Hydropower utilizes the natural phenomenon of waterfalls to generate electricity.
Hydropower contributes to the goal of sustainable development by providing clean and renewable energy.
